page.title: 17HEALTH AND SOCIAL WELFARE
page.content: There are no surgeries, pharmacies, hospitals or clinics and villagers must go to Bridge, Barham or Canter- bury for health care. Doctors visit patients' homes only in cases of ser- ious illness. Hospital care, including maternity, is at the Kent and Canter- bury Hospital. Dentists, too, are in Canterbury. A monthly Baby Welfare Clinic at Bridge and Barham, attended by a Health Visitor and a Medical Officer, operates an immunisation programme. Home helps are available through the Social Services, as is a Chiropody Service. Community Nurses and Health Visitors are attached to surgeries and visit patients at the doctor's request. The elderly and mentally handicapped are able to go to Day Centres and Special Schools in Canterbury. Meals on Wheels takes hot food twice weekly to the housebound.
